results.firPara: • France midfielder rejected offer from Everton to move to London
results.secPara: Moussa Sissoko became a £30m Tottenham Hotspur player late on Wednesday night after Newcastle Uniteds long game of brinksmanship concluded with an audacious hijacking of Evertons bid to sign the France midfielder.
results.webTitle: Tottenham gazump Everton and land Moussa Sissoko for £30m

results.firPara: On the final day of the transfer window, David Luiz made a surprise return to Chelsea from PSG, while Bournemouth captured Jack Wilshere on a seasons loan
results.secPara: On the final day of the transfer window, David Luiz made a surprise return to Chelsea from PSG, while Bournemouth captured Jack Wilshere on a seasons loan
results.webTitle: Transfer news: Chelsea sign David Luiz; Moussa Sissoko, Jack Wilshere, Islam Slimani – as it happened

results.firPara: • Brazil defender moves back to Stamford Bridge on three-year deal
results.secPara: Chelseas summer-long pursuit of defensive reinforcements prompted an outlay close to £60m on transfer deadline day, with the eye-catching return of David Luiz from Paris Saint-Germain complementing Marcos Alonsos arrival from Fiorentina.
results.webTitle: David Luiz completes shock return to Chelsea from PSG for £34m

results.firPara: Joe Hart is set to start Englands opening World Cup qualifier against Slovakia on Sunday after Fraser Forster was forced to withdraw from Sam Allardyces squad after picking up a minor injury in training.
results.secPara: The England manager had been giving serious consideration to picking Forster in Trnava, only for the player to return to Southampton for treatment on an arm injury. With another of Allardyces options, Jack Butland still absent injured at Stoke City, Hart, now on loan at Torino, is expected to win his 64th cap in the opening game in Group F.
results.webTitle: Joe Hart to start for England in Slovakia after Fraser Forster pulls out

results.firPara: Time has offered Danny Drinkwater a sense of perspective but retreat, briefly, to late May and that unwelcome summons to Roy Hodgsons office at The Grove and it was harder to see the bigger picture. The recently crowned Premier League winner had been brought crashing back down to earth with confirmation he was one of those unfortunates to be culled from Englands provisional squad for the European Championship. A player who had been on such a high ended up departing for his summer holidays rather deflated.
results.secPara: Fast forward almost three months and, restored to the national setup by Sam Allardyce for Sundays opening World Cup qualifier in Slovakia, he can pluck positives even from that numbing disappointment. I kind of knew it was coming, when Andros [Townsend] and I were called to the managers room, and I did understand it, he said. Its probably best I didnt finish last season on just winning the title because I might have got sloppy this time round, settling for what Id done. Actually ending the season on a bit of a low kicked me back into gear to get going again this season. Football is full of highs and lows and there were enough highs last season, so I cant complain. In saying that, during that tournament in France, I was wishing I was there.
results.webTitle: Danny Drinkwater: England axe for Euro 2016 has made me more hungry

results.firPara: • Algeria striker signs five-year deal with Premier League champions
results.secPara: Leicester City finally sealed their primary target of the transfer window on Wednesday night after Islam Slimani completed a medical in Italy prior to his move to the Premier League champions, with the Algeria striker making the switch for a club record £30m from Sporting Lisbon on a five-year deal.
results.webTitle: Leicester finally get their man with £30m signing of Islam Slimani

results.firPara: The final phase of Australias journey towards the 2018 World Cup begins on Thursday against the mercurial Iraq, but tougher assignments lie ahead
results.secPara: The final phase of Australias journey towards the 2018 World Cup begins on Thursday against the mercurial Iraq, but tougher assignments lie ahead
results.webTitle: Socceroos' road to Russia may be long but they would not have it any other way | John Duerden

results.firPara: • Republic of Ireland midfielder Hendrick joins from Derby County
results.secPara: Burnley broke their transfer record for the second time this summer when they signed the Derby County midfielder Jeff Hendrick for £10.5m. But an attempt to sign the Poland winger Kamil Grosicki in a £7m deal from Rennes collapsed.
results.webTitle: Burnley make Jeff Hendrick £10.5m record signing but Grosicki deal collapses

results.firPara: Tottenham have signed Georges-Kévin Nkoudou from Marseille on a five-year contract more than 40 days after he passed his medical, with the Spurs forward Clinton Njie joining the French club on a season-long loan.
results.secPara: In one of the most protracted transfer sagas of any transfer window and which saw the Spurs head of recruitment, Paul Mitchell, tender his resignation, Nkoudou has signed a five-year deal at White Hart Lane for a fee of around £9.4m – a reduction of £1.6m from the fee agreed with Marseille in mid-July. The Tottenham chairman, Daniel Levy, attempted to restructure the deal despite the 21-year-old forward having already completed a medical and negotiations broke down.
results.webTitle: Georges-Kévin Nkoudou seals Tottenham transfer – 40 days late

results.firPara: • Fee for Brazilian defender agreed at initial £38m
results.secPara: Chelsea are set to bring back David Luiz from Paris Saint-Germain after confirming they have struck a deal for the defender. The fee is understood to be an initial £38m. David Luiz has agreed personal terms and is due to have his medical in London on Wednesday evening.
results.webTitle: Chelsea confirm deal struck for David Luiz to return from PSG
